intro: Saxifraga laetevirens, commonly known as the cheerful green saxifrage, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. The plant features dark green, succulent leaves and small, white or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. It is often found in mountainous areas and is considered a hardy species capable of surviving in harsh environmental conditions. Saxifraga laetevirens is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and resilience.
